intro: Conophytum stegmannianum, commonly known as the "Stegmann's conophytum," is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family and is characterized by its fleshy, rounded leaves that store water, enabling it to survive in arid conditions. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of yellow and orange during the warmer months. It is often grown as a rock garden plant due to its compact size and ornamental appeal. Conophytum stegmannianum requires minimal water and well-draining soil to thrive.
